where $s$ is the arc length along the curves of $\alpha$-helix centerline, $\omega = 2\pi/p$ is the rate of helical winding and $q=p\omega/2\pi$ is the rate of advance of the curve along $z$-axis. Note that since the $\alpha$-helix is essentially inextensible \cite{Choe2005}, the constraint $q=\sqrt{1-R^2 \omega^2}$ or $\omega=1/\sqrt{R^2+(p/2\pi)^2}$ is in place.
